item.title: Diana add a quote by Max Lucado
item.description: "A woman's heart should be so hidden in God that a man has to seek Him just to find her." -- Max Lucado

item.title: Diana add a quote by Paul (apostle of Christ)
item.description: "Share with Godâ€™s people who are in need. Practice Hospitality Romans 12:13 " -- Paul (apostle of Christ)

item.title: Diana add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Silently, one by one, in the infinite meadows of heaven, Blossomed the lovely stars, the forget-me-nots of the angels." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Diana add a quote by Vincent Willem van Gogh
item.description: "I dream my painting and I paint my dream." -- Vincent Willem van Gogh

item.title: Diana add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Diana add a quote by Lewis Carroll
item.description:
"Alice laughed. 'There's no use trying,' she said. 'One can't believe impossible things.'
I daresay you haven't had much practice,' said the Queen. 'When I was your age, I always did it for half-an-hour a day. Why, sometimes I've believed as many as six impossible things before breakfast. There goes the shawl again!" -- Lewis Carroll

item.title: Diana add a quote by lewis carroll
item.description: "If you drink much from a bottle marked 'poison' it is certain to disagree with you sooner or later." -- lewis carroll

item.title: Diana add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Diana add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "God can't give us peace and happiness apart from Himself because there is no such thing." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Diana add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My concern is not whether God is on our side; my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Diana add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "We have come from God, and inevitably the myths woven by us, though they contain error, will also reflect a splintered fragment of the true light, the eternal truth that is with God. Indeed only by myth-making, only by becoming 'sub-creator' and inventing stories, can Man aspire to the state of perfection that he knew before the Fall. Our myths may be misguided, but they steer however shakily towards the true harbour, while materialistic 'progress' leads only to a yawning abyss and the Iron Crown of the power of evil." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Diana add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "A mind is like a parachute. It doesn't work if it is not open." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Diana add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Commit thy works unto the Lord, and thy thoughts shall be established" (Psalms 16:3)." -- Anonymous

item.title: Diana add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Lord, be my rock of safety, the stronghold that saves me. For the honor of your name lead me and guide me." -- Anonymous

item.title: Diana add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Diana add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche
